alert.note: Alert for Effingham (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 2:33PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Effingham County through 315 PM CDT... At 232 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Wrights Corner, or 15 miles west of Effingham, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Altamont around 240 PM CDT. Shumway around 250 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Effingham, Watson, Teutopolis and Dieterich. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 between mile markers 144 and 167. Interstate 70 between mile markers 79 and 102. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
